title: Not DIN
content:
Hi Girlz/Boyz!

If somebody could help me with these:  
It is a bit like DIN But it is not that!  
I took two photos from a brochure - different sizes maybe help you!  
DIN is a masterpiece but overused...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032030im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DINLikeFontSample02_5023.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032030im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DINLikeFontSample01_3811.png)

Thank you!
author: Mudan

comments.content:
I could have sworn it was Apex New for GEOCACHING

[http://vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032030/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/")

But it’s not... the G is isn’t anyway

I have no idea ... but I quite like ’em

would also like to know

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Solid Creative](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032030/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

This Apex is very similar...

It is a font of a hungarian phone company, called “Pannon”.  
Maybe they bought a licence for altering a font-so it is a unique one for a company...
It is more condensed than Apex and for the first sight te “b” and the “g” is different.

As I see for the first sight you really got it! :)

How the hell did you find this designer/font/site...??? :)))

But thank you anyway!!!
